# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a simple implementation in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""
    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
        end
        wrapped_text *= " $word"
    end
    return wrapped_text
end
```
This function `wrap_string` splits the input string into words, then iterates over these words. For each word, it checks if the combined length of the current line plus this new word would exceed the maximum allowed width (`text_width`). If so, it appends a newline character to start a new line. It then always appends a space followed by the word to the `wrapped_text` string.

For example:

```julia
println(wrap_string("This is an example sentence", 15))
# Output:
# This is an
# example sentence

println(wrap_string("This is another longer example sentence", 20))
# Output:
# This is another
# longer example
# sentence
```
